result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus T Kolen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus T Kolen

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM Defendant Marcus T Kolen in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Marcus T Kolen.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zaleski states that there is a joint agreement to enter a plea on count 1 for 3 years of probation. Count 2 will be DRI. Court goes over the plea questionnaire. Court finds a factual basis. MK enters a NC plea. Attorney Harper and Attorney Zaleski heard. MK speaks. 

Count 1:
Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 3 years.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.
Credit in the event of revocation: 16 days
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today 

Count 2: DRI
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:18 PM Defendant Marcus T Kolen in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Marcus T Kolen.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zaleski states that they do not have a resolution today and asks for another status. 

Attorney Harper informs the court that Judge McDougal did represent the defendant for a short period of time. Judge McDougal informs the parties that she would recuse if they would like. Attorney Zaleski will see what the offer is that Attorney Harper gives and speak with his client.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
9/14 Status rescheduled to accommodate Richland Co. Jury Trial.

Blood or urine on demand of law enforcement.

11:02 AM Defendant Marcus T Kolen in court.  Attorney Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson appears for the defendant. Defendant has received the complaint. Court goes over the criminal complaint. Court speaks about a preliminary hearing. Attorney Erickson notes that the defendant  need to be reappointed due to conflict issues.

Attorney Harper asks for a $500 cash bond with the same prior conditions. Attorney Erickson speaks about bond and request that the prior bond be reinstated. Attorney Erickson state that the new address is 975 West Seminary Street in Richland center. Court orders $400 cash bond with the same prior conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
From RCSD; defendant in custody
Return on warrant on June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

4:04 PM Defendant Marcus T Kolen not in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal appears in person. Attorney McDougal doesn't know where her client is. State asks for a warrant. Court orders warrant.

Attorney McDougal states that she has a conflict with this case due to an item in the criminal complaint. Defendant needs to contact the public defenders office.
Blood or urine on demand of law enforcement.
